intro: Sicydium lindheimeri var. tenuisectum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sicydium, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are often borne on short pedicels. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a notable species for ecological studies and horticultural interest.
